intro: Brodiaea spegazzinii var. angustiloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaved brodiaea, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer, producing clusters of white or pale blue flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or open habitats. This variety is notable for its compact growth habit and ornamental value in gardens.
